articles.title: Women win big in the midterms
articles.description: Women were majorly successful in the midterm elections, taking at least 110 Senate seats between the House and the Senate – smashing a record. Stephanie Ruhle is joined by Mara Gay, former Congressman Steve Israel, Cornell Belcher, and John Weaver to discuss …

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: What is the way forward for Dems after the midterms?
articles.description: Doris Kearns Goodwin, Eugene Robinson and Michael Steele join the Morning Joe panel for a break down of Tuesday's midterms.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: How Democrats and Republicans won in the midterms
articles.description: Following the highly anticipated midterm elections, Stephanie Ruhle breaks down what’s next for the Senate and House at the start of a new era in Washington and across the country.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Voting rights took a step forward in 2018 elections
articles.description: One observer described this year's results as the "best election for voting rights in decades."
articles.content: It’s been a while since voting-rights advocates had reason to celebrate, but the latest election results were clearly a step in a progressive direction. The most dramatic change occurred in Michigan. Michigan … passed a law significantly changing the way the … [+1646 chars]

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Democrats find their footing in several Rust Belt states
articles.description: If the "blue wall" in the Rust Belt crumbled in 2016, Democrats took steps to put it back together again in 2018.
articles.content: Ahead of the 2016 presidential election, Democrats weren’t just optimistic because of the polls. They also spent quite a bit of time fiddling with sites like 270 to Win, exploring different scenarios with the electoral college, and concluding that Donald Trum… [+1873 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Nelson’s chief of staff says Florida Senate race headed to recount
articles.description: The chief of staff for Florida Senator Bill Nelson tells NBC there will be a recount, per state law which requires an automatic recount if there is less than a half percent between the vote totals. NBC’s Catie Beck and Steve Kornacki break down what happens n…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Carole King sings us out on Wednesday morning
articles.description: A special, post-election show deserves a special ending: The legendary Carole King sings the panel out at the end of Wednesday's show.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Health care was on the ballot in 2018,...
articles.description: With minor exceptions, yesterday was an excellent day for health care advocates.
articles.content: It was just a few weeks ago when Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-Ky.) said out loud what was widely assumed to be true: if Republicans held onto their congressional majorities, the GOP would try again to repeal the Affordable Care Act. Last week, La… [+1918 chars]

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: House 'popular vote' gives Democrats something to brag about
articles.description: Republicans had all kinds of advantages, including a strong economy and gerrymandered maps, but the GOP got slammed in House races anyway.
articles.content: In the 1994 midterms, Republicans posted huge gains and took control of Congress. Time magazine published a cover image of a powerful, triumphant elephant crushing a donkey, under a headline that called it a GOP stampede. Republicans had reason to crow at the… [+1905 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Back at the board, Kornacki assesses the returns
articles.description: Steve Kornacki returns to the 2018 midterm board to recap Wednesday night and to discuss the races that are yet to be called.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump tweets challenge to Dems over possible probes
articles.description: In a tweet about the Dems picking up the House, Trump says if the party wastes 'Taxpayer Money investigating us,' he would be forced to investigate the Dems.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Why the new House Democratic majority...
articles.description: It's not just the death of the White House's legislative agenda: Trump is wholly unprepared for the kind of oversight and accountability he'll soon face.
articles.content: In April, Donald Trump hosted a dinner with Republican congressional leaders, who tried to deliver a stern warning to the president about the 2018 midterm elections. They were concerned about the party’s hold on congressional power, and as the New York Times … [+3516 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Mika honors the women who ran in '18 midterms
articles.description: Mika Brzezinski shares her thoughts on the outcome of Tuesday's midterm elections.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Former Navy pilot, prosecutor wins NJ, headed to DC
articles.description: Former Navy helicopter pilot and federal prosecutor Mikie Sherrill won the race for New Jersey's 11th U.S. Congressional District on Wednesday evening, and she joins Morning Joe to discuss her win.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: One-party rule comes to an end in Washington
articles.description: Democrats may have lost key Senate and gubernatorial races in Texas and Florida, but they picked up the House and Joe Scarborough says this returns a balance to Washington and an end to one-party rule.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Joe: For first time in two years, it doesn't matter what Trump...
articles.description: The president closed out midterm campaigning by playing to the base's fears on immigration and on race. With the GOP picking up Senate seats despite a House win for Dems, will Trump continue his rhetoric into 2020? The panel discusses.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Mueller investigation more secure with Democrats leading House
articles.description: An MSNBC panel discusses what the Democratic takeover of the House of Representatives means to the Robert Mueller investigation.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Minimum wage, redistricting, Medicaid get 2018 voter blessings
articles.description: Rachel Maddow reviews the outcome for some state ballot proposals, including non-partisan redistricting, minimum wage, and Medicaid expansion.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: House Democrats to replace Trump lap dogs with accountability
articles.description: An MSNBC panel discusses how House Republicans were so permissive of the Donald Trump administration's transgressions that their acquiescence became expected, and how House Democrats will now be able to issue subpoenas and pursue investigations that Republica…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Jacob Soboroff's election night coverage sets off alarm bells
articles.description: While demonstrating the how ballots are counted in Orange County, California, Jacob Soboroff seemingly sets off alarm bells.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Nadler warns Trump against firing Mueller as Dems win House in blue wave
articles.description: Ranking Member and likely incoming Chairman of the House Judiciary Committee tells Ari Melber  “all options are on the table” if Trump tries to “sabotage” the probe, or fires “key people,” or abuses the pardon power, laying down a firm marker on protecting Bo…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Republicans lose claim to 'party of law & order'
articles.description: An MSNBC panel remark on the willingness of Republican voters to elect candidates under federal indictment, and how that fact contrasts with the Republican Party's desire to present itself as prioritizing law and order.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Hayes: Texas Democrats should be optimistic despite Beto loss
articles.description: Despite Beto O'Rourke's loss in Florida, Chris Hayes says that Texas Democrats feel like it was the best night for their state party in a generation.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: How will Trump handle a Democratic Congress?
articles.description: An MSNBC panel discuss whether Donald Trump and Republicans are more likely to try to deal with House Democrats when they take the majority or adopt a combative posture to deepen Congressional gridlock.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Andrew Gillum concedes Florida governor race
articles.description: Andrew Gillum concedes Florida governor race: 'I sincerely regret that I couldn't bring it home for you, but I can guarantee you this: I'm not going anywhere. We're going to fight.'

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rep. Schiff: Mueller likelier to finish his work
articles.description: Rep. Adam Schiff is poised to become chairman of the House Intelligence Committee when Democrats take control of the House.  He says the GOP abdicated their responsibility on the Russia investigation and that he plans to restore relationships between the comm…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Schmidt: 'The unchecked corruption is at its end'
articles.description: Steve Schmidt remarks on the major headlines from election night, the first being that Donald Trump now has a check on his power, having lost permission Republican control in the House, and the other being that divisions over Trump in American politics were d…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump taxes a likely tool for insights on Trump finances
articles.description: Stephanie Ruhle explains what could come from Democrats getting access to Donald Trump's tax returns.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Democratic House control means leadership shake-up in Congress
articles.description: Donna Edwards, former Maryland congresswoman, talks about how the new Democratic leadership will take shape now that they've taken control of Congress.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: With House majority, Dems intend to request for Trump's tax returns
articles.description: Ari Melber reports, Democrats "intend to request President Trump's tax returns" if they take the House, as NBC News projects they will.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Democrats still see victory in Beto O'Rourke loss; 2020 pondered
articles.description: As NBC News projects a victory for Ted Cruz against Beto O'Rourke, Evan Smith, founder and CEO of the Texas Tribune discusses why Democrats are heartened by Beto O'Rourke's performance against Ted Cruz even though he lost, and considers O'Rourke's future plan…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Nicolle: This changes everything
articles.description: NBC News projects Democrats did take back control of the House but lost their bid for the Senate after Rep. Beto O'Rourke lost to Sen. Ted Cruz. Nicolle Wallace noted that the change in House control is a 'game changer' for President Trump.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Kris Kobach loses Kansas governor race to Democrat Laura Kelly
articles.description: Kansas Secretary of State Kris Kobach loses the Kansas governor race to Democrat Laura Kelly. Rachel Maddow and the MSNBC panel discuss.

articles.title: MTP Daily 11/6/18
articles.description: MTP Daily is a public affairs program hosted by Chuck Todd that follows the Trump administration and features the top news-makers of the day as they analyze and break down the issues.

articles.title: Florida votes to restore voting rights for felons
articles.description: Florida voters have restored the rights to vote for felons with its approval of Amendment 4 to its state constitution. The amendment, which passed with at least a 2 million-plus margin, paves the way for potentially millions of convicted felons in the state t…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: What is happening in Florida?
articles.description: MSNBC's Steve Kornacki takes a look at the nail biter in Florida for the governor race as of 9 p.m. ET.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Initial House estimates favor Democrats, but not without danger
articles.description: Steve Kornacki reports near the top of 9 p.m. ET hour that the initial estimate from the NBC News Decision Desk gives Democrats a 65% chance of taking control of the House, though the margin of error on their estimate includes a Democratic loss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Sen. McCaskill: 'I have no flipping idea what’s going to happen tonight'
articles.description: Senator Claire McCaskill joins MSNBC to discuss the latest returns coming out of the MIssouri Senate Race between her and challenger Josh Hawley.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Never say never: Can Beto O'Rourke pull out a win in Texas?
articles.description: WaPo’s Jackie Alemany, former Obama CoS Jim Messina, former DOJ spox Matt Miller, MSNBC analyst Elise Jordan, and Steve Schmidt on the tight senate race in Texas

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: James Carville: 'It's not going to be a wave election'
articles.description: Carville remains optimistic even though it's not quite the Blue Wave Democrats were hoping for.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Late visits by the president hurt Senate GOP candidates at the polls
articles.description: Chuck joins the MSNBC Election Night panel to discuss how GOP candidates would not be able to win without Trump's base, but how his appearances in the state hurt their poll numbers.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump, Sessions warn of voter fraud ahead of election without any evidence
articles.description: The Root’s Jason Johnson, Costa former Obama CoS Jim Messina, former DOJ spox Matt Miller, MSNBC analyst Elise Jordan, and Steve Schmidt on Trump and AG Jeff Sessions warning of potential voter fraud in the midterms

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Polls now closed in Georgia
articles.description: Katy Tur reports from an Atlanta precinct as polls just closed in Georgia.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Republicans worry Trump's closing argument will backfire
articles.description: WaPo’s Robert Costa former Obama CoS Jim Messina, former DOJ spox Matt Miller, MSNBC analyst Elise Jordan, and Steve Schmidt on Trump’s influence on the midterm elections
